Fields.DialogueText: Battlestations, everyone! We've got Morganas coming up at starboard midship!
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst? You look perturbed.
Oh, it's nothing. I'm off to kill the radarman.
Heh, heh... Good grief, you're not serious, are you?
What, did the murderous look in my eyes give it away?

Fields.MenuText: I can't believe I'm having to say this, but...please don't kill the radarman.
I don't appreciate threats to my crew, Scharnhorst.
Considering your eyes are always that eerie shade of red, I'm not sure I'd be able to distinguish between what was and was not murderous.

Fields.DialogueText: It will take more than a please to dissuade me.
I don't appreciate close calls with my ship!
The radarman isn't the only person I might murder.
What's the problem?
One too many Morgana submarines have made it far too close to me. That radarman ought to be shot!
It's really not the radarman's fault that your detection systems got fried when the Morganas first appeared. It's a miracle we're able to coax any use out of them at all between electrical fires.
Now, don't you get mad at me...
Did you just insult my radar?!
I think... I think that's the XO calling me. I have to go.
You can't run away from me, Kapitän!
...Scharnhorst? You're looking a little more...serene than you were the last time we talked.
I...had time to consider what you said. It does appear that some of my electrical systems - particularly the detection systems - may have been damaged beyond lasting repair.
That's remarkably level-headed of you to admit, Scharnhorst.
I'm happy to hear you say that.
Why?
Because it gives me hope that you're in a good enough mood to go in for one of these.
One of...what is this?
New technology - some prototype from the Abbott woman. It purports to be a supplemental system for the radar that can track some of the enemy's more specialized electromagnetic functions.
Is that... is that the price of the technology?

Fields.MenuText: That's expensive...
You think the Naval Protection Force has the money to afford that sort of technology?
Bwahahahaha...yeah, right.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you putting a price on my life?
What is the Naval Protection Force more interested in doing? Pinching a few pennies or winning the war?
If you want something to laugh at, I'll give you something to laugh at.
I'm sorry, Scharnhorst. No matter how useful such technology might be, there's just no way the Force can afford it.
What if I were...to raise the money myself?
*ALARM*
If you think you're capable, then go right ahead. Right now, we have Morganas to take care of.
@BATTLE
When I receive a proper restoration of my own radar systems, we must add this to the mix.
Well, I'm usually willing to sign off on-
Scharnhorst, did you steal my binoculars? Aren't you the one always bragging about how great your eyesight is?
My eyesight, while exemplary, does not allow me to see as far as the binoculars do. Now, if you'll excuse me...
No, wait. I don't like that grin on your face. What are you up to?
I'm getting us the money we need to buy that radar modification.
... How?
Well, you see that merchant ship, off toward the eastern horizon...?
Scharnhorst...
What?

Fields.MenuText: We're not pirates. We're not stealing from that ship.
I'm going to pretend I didn't hear that, and I'm going to make sure the crew knows not to follow any orders you give.
As entertaining as the prospect might be, the answer is no.

Fields.DialogueText: It will only be a one time thing! I mean, probably.
You're no fun, you know that?
You sure there's nothing I can say to convince you to change your mind?
Raise the money, and do so legally, understand?
Good grief, why did I have to choose such a bore as my Kapitän?
Captain, Scharnhorst, we have Morganas headed in.
At least you have the Morganas to keep you busy, Scharnhorst.
Was that your attempt at humor?
@BATTLE
So, you really think I can get rich by doing this, Scharnhorst?
It is as sure as Gibraltar. You pay a one time fee for the franchise, and your only limit is how much money you want to make afterwards.
Even better, you’ll receive a portion of the fee from every person you recruit to franchise. Before long, between sales and commissions, you’ll be rich!
Scharnhorst...
Captain, she was just telling me about this exciting business opportunity...
You really ought to know that any time someone uses the words "exciting business opportunity," they're about to dupe you.
Oh... oh. That's not very nice of you, Scharnhorst.
Tsk, tsk.

Fields.MenuText: This should really go without saying, Scharnhorst, but there is no place for pyramid schemes aboard this boat.
I have to say - if you're going to steal from the crew, it's just good form to offer the captain a cut.
You know, you bill yourself as a world-class tactician. I would have thought you capable of coming up with a scheme a little more elegant than this.

Fields.DialogueText: It is perfectly legal. Show me the law against it, if you can.
Steal? Pah! They give consent. Gleefully and greedily, actually.
Okay, now that was just uncalled for.
I am using the means available to me to secure this ship's future, Kapitän. I don't appreciate you standing in my way.
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: Well, now you can take your frustration out on the other things standing in your way.

Fields.DialogueText: @BATTLE
You might want to read up on Adele Spitzeder.
I'm insulted that you would think I hadn't! My licensing fee model entirely bypasses most of the weaknesses of the traditional banking scam!

Fields.MenuText: For the record, I'm not standing in your way. I'm saying you're thinking too small - I know what the crew gets paid.
I'm just saying that the crew's trust in you is one of your greatest assets. Be careful with it.

Fields.DialogueText: A... fair point.
... Perhaps I've underestimated you.
Das ist keine schlechte Idee.
Oh, Kapitän!
What is it, Scharnhorst? Are you trying to scam me this time?
Not at all. No, this time my plan is completely legal. Well, here on the open seas, at least.
What?
Jesper Holm, you've heard of him, haven't you?
A Danish businessman, isn't he? Richer than any one person should be, right?
Precisely. He's holding a casino event aboard his ship. Some of the world's wealthiest people will be there, all gambling their money away.

Fields.MenuText: You think that gambling is the best way to acquire the money you need for the Abbott device?
Where do you think you'll get the money you'll need to even enter an event like that? Certainly not from me.
I thought you could only go ten meters off this boat, Scharnhorst. How are you going to participate in an event you can't physically attend?

Fields.DialogueText: Rest assured, Kapitän. When I'm the one at the table, it's hardly a gamble.
I'll just need a little. I'll be able to work it out.
I...hadn't quite considered that, but I'm sure I can figure it out.
So, what do you say?
Well, it isn't illegal. Or, unethical, since the people at the event will know what they're getting themselves into.
I guess...if you can get yourself an invitation, we'll see about making it happen.
Perfect. Now, I do believe we have Morganas headed this way. Shall we?
This ought to be interesting...
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, what are you working on? I don't see you writing very often.
I'm writing to request an invitation from Jesper Holm.
Your handwriting is...quite elegant. I'm impressed.
And why is that?

Fields.MenuText: No reason in particular. The next time I'm looking to impress someone via writing, I might have you scribe for me.
I would have thought you too busy focusing on battle strategy to take the time to practice your penmanship.
Because–let's be honest–you're not the most elegant Belle out there.

Fields.DialogueText: My services don't come cheap, Kapitän!
What can I say? I'm a well-rounded Belle.
Now, Kapitän, Kapitän. I assure you, I do clean up well.
How good do you think your chances are?
Of what?
Of Holm actually issuing you an invitation.
I have no idea. I'm trying to convey how entertaining it might be to have a real Belle among the guests at his event. We'll see if it works.
You're putting yourself up as entertainment?
I'll do what I need to do to make the money I need.
*ALARM*
Well, that will have to wait until later.
I know, I know.
@BATTLE
You know, Scharnhorst, there are places you could sit other than the very top of the ship!
What?!
For one thing, it makes communication very difficult!
What?!

Fields.MenuText: I said, it makes communication very difficult!
Come down here this instant, Scharnhorst!
I said, you're a handful of a Belle, and sometimes I think twice about whether I want to be your Captain!

Fields.DialogueText: I could hear you. I was just giving you a hard time.
Now, now, there's no reason to be so pushy.
You want to say that again, Kap?
I was just curious whether you'd heard anything from...what's his name. Holm?
Nothing yet. I hate waiting, it's all I can do to sit atop the ship and mastermind various ways to cripple the merchant ships we come across.
You're a bit of a devil, you know that?
I've been called worse. Now, let's go.
Where?
I saw Morganas on the horizon from up top!
@BATTLE
Morganas coming up fast!
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst? Scharnhorst, I recognize that murderous look in your eyes. Who are you off to kill this time?
Jesper Holm.
Oh, dear.
I don't know who died and made him the king of Denmark. He didn't even have the decency to respond to me himself.
Look at this—I'm sure his secretary was the one who sent it.
It does appear a bit formulaic.
Why wouldn't he have invited me? Would I not have made an excellent guest at this sort of event?

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure you would have...fit right in?
Scharnhorst, I assure you, I have no idea how these events are run, or what thought goes into the guest list.
Yeah, that's a solid no.

Fields.DialogueText: You sound a little unsure there, Kapitän.
Well, you're of no help to me.
What did you say?
What are you going to do? Does this put your radar idea to rest?
Hardly, Kapitän. Spend enough time with me, and you'll find that I never give up on anything.
Sometimes, you're absolutely terrifying.
I appreciate that.
Scharnhorst? What is all of this? Ship records, maps...?
I have a plan, Kapitän.
What sort of plan? Should I prepare myself? Will I be imprisoned as a result of what you're planning?
Probably not.
Well, that's reassuring.
Don't worry your little head over what I'm doing here. Go, run your ship, or whatever it is you do here.
If I've learned anything from being around you, Scharnhorst, it's that if you're saying you don't need oversight, that it is the precise time you most need oversight.
Nonsense. I assure you, as far as I'm aware, what I'm doing is not illegal.
Still not reassuring, Scharnhorst!
You know, I do think there are a few Morganas close by.
Oh, you're not getting out of thi—
*ALARM*
Damn.
Like I said. Tell the crew not to touch my papers while I'm away. Because, believe me, if I find a single item out of order here, there will be hell to pay.
I absolutely believe you.
@BATTLE
Oh, Kapitän?
You know, Scharnhorst, it kind of seems as if you only seek me out when you need something.
Why else would I want you?
You really know how to make a person feel good about themselves.
Anyway, I have...a friend I'd like to see.

Fields.MenuText: Well...that's nice. I'm impressed.
What does that mean for me?
You have friends?

Fields.DialogueText: You're impressed that I'm capable of doing something nice? That's really a high bar you've set for me, Kapitän.
So impatient. I'll tell you.
Yes, moron.
She's a non-Belle ship, serving in the Mediterranean. I was hoping...we might be able to go see her.
That's a bit of a trip, Scharnhorst.
Please? I'll...owe you one.
Now, that is the sort of thing I like to hear. We do this, and you'll owe me a favor?
...Yes.
In that case, I'll check with Command and see if we can't make a trip up that direction.
*ALARM*
After this, of course.
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst! We have Morganas on our tail...the Mediterranean is absolutely crawling with them! Get ready to fight!
Not quite yet.
Say what, now?
Visibility is poor! We need to make our way north!
Wha–what are you talking about? Visibility is fine!
The waters are too choppy! We need to keep going!

Fields.MenuText: Are you all right, Scharnhorst?
We're putting the ship in needless danger the longer we avoid a fight. We need to face the Morganas now!
What are you up to?

Fields.DialogueText: Yep, fine! Keep going!
No, we need better positioning! To the north!
...Nothing.
Come on, where are...
Where are...what? Scharnhorst, what are you looking for? And give me back my binoculars, would you?
Aha! This is the perfect positioning, Kapitän. Now, let's face those Morganas.
Wh-where did those civilian ships come from? Scharnhorst, we've led the Morganas straight to them! Their ships aren't equipped for this fight!
Did we? Oh, darn. Well, I guess we'll just need to rescue any civilians who need our help.
O...kay.
@BATTLE
I'm so happy we made it there in time! Imagine what would have happened if the Morganas had shown up before we arrived!
Scharnhorst, who is this you're talking to?
Kapitän, this is one of the civilians we pulled out of the sea after the Morgana attack.
Oh, of course. Welcome aboard. Please, make yourself as comfortable as you can. I'm the Captain of this ship.
I can't thank you enough for your assistance, Captain. I'm Jesper Holm.

Fields.MenuText: E–excuse me? I think I might have misheard you.
Would you excuse me, Mr. Holm? I need a private word with my Belle, here.
Of...course you are. Of course.

Fields.DialogueText: You heard him, Kapitän.
I think anything you want to say to me, you can say in front of Mr. Holm, here.
I've never seen you quite this tongue-tied, Kapitän.
Your ship, it was...uh, destroyed during that battle, wasn't it?
It was, I'm afraid. A terrible stroke of luck, and just before I was to host a large event. My guests will be devastated.
About that, Mr. Holm...
Scharnhorst...
*ALARM*
Oh, dear. Are those...?
More Morganas? Looks like it. Don't worry a hair on that handsome head of yours, Mr. Holm. I have everything under control!
Thank you, Scharnhorst!
You have to be kidding me.
@BATTLE
Mr. Holm! There you are. W-what are you doing?
Taking measurements of the ship, Captain.
...Why?
Scharnhorst graciously offered to host my event on her ship. I'm planning out what we'll put where–the tables, food, drinks–you understand.
Mr. Holm, basic human decency requires me to tell you, Scharnhorst, she—
Planned this from the beginning?
She...told you?
No, of course not. But she writes, asking for an invitation, and upon being rejected, shows up soon after, with a herd of Morganas in tow. I'm not an idiot, Captain.
She was directly responsible for the destruction of your ship, and you're doing what she wants, hosting your event aboard her ship anyway?
I like bold people, Captain. Bold, clever people. Miss Scharnhorst has proven herself to be as bold and clever as they come. I find her company...refreshing.
I do not understand you...at all. But as long as you're happy...?
I am!
*ALARM*
I'm going to go fight Morganas now because that is a world which makes sense to me.
I wish you luck, Captain!
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, why is there a mountain of boxes aboard this ship with your name on them?
Oh, those are just the decorations for the casino event. Don't worry, Jesper paid for all of them.
My mind hadn't even broached the issue of payment, actually. I was still dwelling on the immense number of boxes, and what they could possibly all contain.
Everything needed for the party, of course! This warship has to look the part of a casino once Jesper's guests arrive. The decorations alone...
Wait.

Fields.MenuText: What decorations are we talking about here?
No, absolutely not. I do not allow decorations aboard my ship.
This is getting out of hand way too quickly.

Fields.DialogueText: What decorations aren't we talking about here? Jesper really knows how to go all out!
As the ship, I'm pretty sure my vote outranks yours.
Oh, calm down, you limp noodle of a Kapitän. I assure you, everything will be fine.
Scharnhorst! Come over here, darling! You must see this material I ordered from France!
Ooo, is that laced with gold? That's my sort of fabric, Jesper!
This is all a bad dream. There's no other explanation for what's currently happening right now. That's all there is to it.
Sir, we have Morganas headed in.
Thanks. Maybe a swift knock to my head will wake me up.
@BATTLE
Battlestations everyone, we've got incoming!
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst—woah.
Look at this place, Kapitän. These decorations, it's so...beautiful.
This used to be a warship. At one point in time, we fought wars in this ship.
Oh, stop your moaning and groaning. It's fine! Look how thrilled the crew is by all this! I've never seen them this excited.
I can't believe you were able to convince Jesper to issue them all invitations.
What can I say? Jesper adores me. That's all there is to it.

Fields.MenuText: He really does. I cannot, for the life of me, fathom why.
Between the two of you, I can't decide who I despise more.
Maybe he suffered some brain damage when he had to abandon ship. I mean, that's the only reasonable explanation, isn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: It's my sparkling personality, obviously.
Oh, you know you despise me more.
It couldn't just be that I'm excellent company?
Say, you think we could keep the decorations up, even once the event is over?
Why would I say yes to that?
It's just that the ship is normally so drab. I like surrounding myself with luxury.
That's not surprising.
So, what do you say?
I say, if I can get through the event with no more a tension headache than what I'm currently suffering, that I might let you decorate your quarters with all this.
Hmm, I'll take it!
Scharnhorst! Scharnhorst!
Goodness, Kapitän, there's no need to yell. You'll frighten all of the rich people on board.
It is an especially wealthy crowd, isn't it? I can't, for the life of me, figure out why they think having this event on a warship is such a good idea.
Scharnhorst! Oh, you wonderful darling! This party is absolutely magnificent!
Like I said.
The way you and Jesper have redecorated this hulk of a boat, I do think you've started the newest trend.
I heard a friend of mine say he was planning to go to a ship graveyard after this and find a boat of his own to fix up!
You must be kidding me.
Be nice, Kap.
And who is this, Scharnhorst? Is this the Captain of the ship?
The one and only.
Well, aren't you absolutely adorable?

Fields.MenuText: A–adorable?
Ma'am, I'll have to ask that you please stop touching my face.
I have some adjectives I could throw your way, ma'am.

Fields.DialogueText: Not a word you hear very often, is it, Kap?
Heh. Oh, this party is the best.
Hush, you! Don't ruin this for me.
*ALARM*
That is a very loud noise...don't you think you could replace it with anything more soothing?
Sorry, ma'am. We need to go.
@BATTLE
Attention, everyone! We're about to start the main event. The poker tournament is about to begin!
Scharnhorst, do you even know how to play poker?
Hahahahahahahahaha...
Why are you laughing at me?
...hahahahahahahahahaha...
I mean, seriously? You're not going to go out there and lose all your money, are you?
...hahahahahahahahahaha...

Fields.MenuText: All right, I get the message. You know how to play poker.
You're a real pain sometimes, you know that?
It would be a shame if you passed out from all this laughing and missed the tournament.

Fields.DialogueText: ...hahahaha...you think?
...hahahaha... I do!
...hahahaha...rest assured, my luck is much better than that.
Whew! That felt great. Thanks for the laugh, Kap, it was just what I needed before starting this tournament.
...I'm so pleased I could be of help.
*ALARM*
Well, it looks as if we'll need to hold off for a little longer...
Come on, Kap. We'll see if these Morganas are as big a riot as you.
Har har.
@BATTLE
More Morganas, come to disrupt the party!
@BATTLE
How's your hand?
You've been staring over my shoulder since the game began. Shouldn't you know?
Well, I know how I'd feel about those cards, but I don't know how you feel about those cards.
I'd really rather not discuss my cards while playing, Kap.
Oh, is the Unflappable Scharnhorst not quite as unflappable as she lets on?
The Unflappable Scharnhorst will personally turn you inside out if you ruin this for her.
Turn me inside out?

Fields.MenuText: ...Ugh.
I don't appreciate threats, Scharnhorst.
That's the best threat you could come up with? I would have expected better from you.

Fields.DialogueText: Such a threat has a stupefying effect which I very much appreciate.
Then stop talking!
I only make threats I know I'm personally capable of seeing through.
I know we've had our fair share of differences, but if we've gone to this much trouble, I really do want you to do well. Is there anything I can do to help?
You're serious?
I am.
Well, um...you could get me a glass of water, I guess.
I'll take care of it!
That Captain of yours is a bit of an odd duck, Scharnhorst.
Don't I know it.
Things aren't going so well, are they?
What is that comment supposed to do? Make me feel better?
Sorry, sorry. I'm just a little anxious, that's all.
You're anxious? You're not the one who put up...never mind.
Put up...what? Scharnhorst?
How much money did you have to put up to play in this tournament?
I'd rather not tell you, since there's no way you'll respond well.

Fields.MenuText: I'd appreciate a little more faith in my ability to behave maturely, Scharnhorst.
If you thought that comment would convince me to leave you alone, you were wrong.
I can start responding badly now, and continue doing so until you've told me.

Fields.DialogueText: I know you're mature. Even a mature person would react poorly to hearing the amount.
I'm plenty adept at tuning out annoyances.
Somehow, I don't think you'll actually make a fool of yourself in front of these people. It might get back to Command, after all.
At least tell me this.
No, the crew gave me their winnings from the event.
What?
*ALARM*
Oh, thank goodness. Sorry everyone, we have to take a break. Duty calls!
@BATTLE
Another wave of Morganas!
@BATTLE
Have you calmed down a little, Kapitän?
I was able to release some of my rage during that last battle, so I'm doing better than I was.
The crew are adults. If they want to pitch in so I can get new detection systems, that's their prerogative.
If the situation was really that simple, I would agree with you. But they gave their winnings to you in pursuit of a bigger gamble.
What if you lose? You were in the process of losing before we had to take care of that last Morgana. What will your loss do to the morale on this ship?
Ah, but I won't lose, Kapitän.
How can you possibly be that confident? I saw your cards...
Did you, though? Perhaps your eyes weren't as sharp as you'd assumed.
What...?
Everyone, a round of applause for Scharnhorst, the Captain and their esteemed crew in that last battle.
*applause*
Now, let's return our attention to this game. It is turning out to be a bit of a marathon, isn't it?
Where Morganas are concerned, it's a miracle we're progressing through the game at all...
Oh, this isn't good...
Hush, would you?
Our high hand is a spade flush. This is getting exciting, everyone.
Look at the expressions on the crew's faces. They're so hopeful, so naive. They really think you're about to win.
Shut your mouth, would you?
Scharnhorst?
Ah, yes! My apologies, Jesper.
You're the last player at the table. Show us—what do you have?
I suppose it's time...
*gasp*
Wha...?
It's a full house! Scharnhorst, you've won the tournament! Congratulations, my dear!
*applause*

Fields.MenuText: But I saw her cards...
Maybe I've been mixing up poker with another game, all this time.
You little cheat.

Fields.DialogueText: Like I said, maybe your eyes aren't as sharp as you thought.
I'm sure that's the issue.
Guests, every cent of what I've won today will go toward equipping this ship with the most modern of technology, so that we're better equipped to fight the Morgana threat.
Your money is assisting us in saving the world. Thank you for your contributions.
*ALARM*
We need to go, Scharnhorst.
I'm right behind you, Kap!
@BATTLE
Well, Scharnhorst, that's the last of the guests. It's just you, me, and the crew now.
All of those rich people, gone. I should have spent more time pickpocketing while they were all aboard.
What, it was a joke! I mean, don't get me wrong. I saw plenty of opportunities to steal a bauble or two, but I contented myself with simply winning their money.
Ha!
Was that a guffaw I just heard, Kapitän?
You and I both know—you didn't win, you cheated.
What can I say? I make my own luck.
And it's as if you feel no shame for your actions.
Tell me—why would I feel ashamed? It wasn't as if I was robbing orphans here, Kap!
And, what's more, I was doing this for the good of our fight against the Morganas. Tell me, in what world did I do something wrong?

Fields.MenuText: Your consideration for the war effort is commendable. Your actions, less so.
Society has rules for a reason, Scharnhorst.
I just don't like the idea of having to deal with the fallout of your actions, should anyone find out what you did.

Fields.DialogueText: Consideration alone won't defeat the Morganas, Kap.
Sometimes those rules need to be thrown out the window, for the good of everyone.
Don't worry yourself—no one will find out.
Captain, Scharnhorst, we have Morganas on their way.
We'll be there momentarily. Thank you.
@BATTLE
There's another wave of Morganas!
@BATTLE
Scharnhorst, about that last battle... Wait, who are all of these people? Where did they come from?
These are January Abbott's people, Kap. Here to install the new radar tech.
I didn't realize a small army was necessary for such work.
They should have it working before we know it. Exciting, isn't it? To see the fruits of your labor...
Labor?
Maybe the wrong choice of words.
What did you want to say about that last battle?
Just...as usual, good work.
I am rather magnificent, aren't I?
Now, what?
You really only care about yourself, don't you?
Oh, brother...
Admit it.
Don't get all high-minded on me, Kapitän. I do the work I'm given. Whether or not I care about anything or anyone else really isn't your concern. Now, if you'll excuse me...
Enemies in the water!
@BATTLE
Who are you off to kill now, Scharnhorst?
Half the ship's electrical systems are down until Abbott's men finish installing the new technology.
I know. I'm on my way to kill them.

Fields.MenuText: I would really rather you not kill anyone aboard this ship.
Remember, the crew helped pay for that new technology. They probably wouldn't be too pleased if you killed the only people capable of installing it.
You really make no sense to me, you know that?

Fields.DialogueText: Sometimes we can't always get what we want, Kapitän.
A lot of good it did them.
That's on you, not me.
Those technicians were supposed to have finished the installation by now. As a result of their inability, Morganas have been able to sneak up on us.
We have four crew members in the infirmary as a result. If death isn't what those technicians deserve, then...
Death isn't what they deserve. They're doing the best they can. I'm fairly certain they're not used to working on a German battlecruiser.
Excuse me?
Battleship! Battleship! I'm sorry.
Yeah, you better be.
...Wait.
Battlestations, everyone! Morganas coming our way!
@BATTLE
You have a weird smile on your face, Kap.
Yes, I do.
It's a little terrifying.
I realized something.
And, what? You're here to enlighten me? If I'm going to have a smile that creepy on my face after hearing what you have to say, I'd much rather you stay silent.
You do care about other people.
Oh, so you've lost your mind, then? That explains the smile.
You were very worked up when Abbott's technicians failed to have the device ready in time.
They endangered my ship.
You weren't concerned about yourself. You were concerned about your crew.
Admit it, you like them. Why else would you have convinced Holm to let them come to the event?
So they would give me their money.
I mean, sure, that probably had a lot to do with it, but you were excited that they were excited. You like them.
No.
You care about them.
Shut up!
I'm never going to not know that. Deep down, you're a good person.
I hate you!

Fields.MenuText: Heh, making fun of her isn't going to get old any time soon.
It's good to know that she's actually capable of caring for other people.
